text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron liliiflorum (百合花杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to Guangxi, Guizhou, Hunan, and southeast Yunnan, China, where it grows at altitudes of 2800–4500 meters. It is a shrub or small tree that grows to 3 m in height, with leathery, oblong leaves, 7–16 by 2–5 cm in size. Flowers are predominantly white.
text.References:
"Rhododendron liliiflorum", H. Léveillé, Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. 12: 102. 1913.
